page.title: 11HOME LIFE (2)
page.content: IN THE AFTERNOON SOMETIMES I HELP OUT AT THE FARM, WRITING DOWN THE EAR-TAG NUMBERS IN A BOOK WHILE MY HUSBAND SORTS THE CATTLE AND HERDS THEM FROM FIELD TO SHED HOLDING THEM STEADY WHILE THEY ARE RECEIVING MEDICATION. AT 4 P.M. THE CHILDREN RETURN HOME FOR TEA. THEY HAVE A COOKED TEA. THE CHIPS ARE COOKED IN THE DEEP FAT FRYER. IN THE SUMMER THEY PLAY IN THE GARDEN. THE BOY PLAYS WITH HIS TOY CARS THE GIRL SKIPS AND PLAYS HOP-SCOTCH. I FEED THE DOG WITH THE TINNED DOG FOOD. IN THE EVENING WE WATCH T.V. I SOMETIMES SEW OR KNIT. NOT ALL WOMEN STAY HOME ALL DAY, SOME HAVE PART-TIME WORK OR FULL TIME EMPLOYMENT. A MOBILE LIBRARY VISITS THE AREA ONCE A FORTNIGHT.
